prompt: <description>**Instructions for part 1:** Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with zero rotation and zero translation. Next, create a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a loop with four lines. The first line starts at (0,0) and ends at (0.0203, 0). The second line starts at (0.0203, 0) and ends at (0.0203, 0.0405). The third line starts at (0.0203, 0.0405) and ends at (0, 0.0405). The fourth line starts at (0, 0.0405) and ends at (0, 0), closing the loop. Scale the sketch by 0.0405. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector (0, 0, 0). Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.75 units in the normal direction. **Instructions for part 2:** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles (-90, 0, -90) and the translation vector (0.0101, 0.0199, 0.5669). Next, create a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a loop with four lines. The first line starts at (0,0) and ends at (0.0206, 0). The second line starts at (0.0206, 0) and ends at (0.0206, 0.0412). The third line starts at (0.0206, 0.0412) and ends at (0, 0.0412). The fourth line starts at (0, 0.0412) and ends at (0, 0), closing the loop. Scale the sketch by 0.0412. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (−90, 0, −90) and the translation vector (0.0101, 0.0199, 0.5669). Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0101 units in the normal direction and by 0.0101 units in the opposite direction of the normal. **Instructions for part 3:** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with zero rotation and the translation vector (0, 0, 0.75). Next, create a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a loop with four lines. The first line starts at (0,0) and ends at (0.0101, 0). The second line starts at (0.0101, 0) and ends at (0.0101, 0.0405). The third line starts at (0.0101, 0.0405) and ends at (0, 0.0405). The fourth line starts at (0, 0.0405) and ends at (0, 0), closing the loop. Scale the sketch by 0.0405. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector (0, 0, 0.75). Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0206 units in the opposite direction of the normal.</description>
